trans-unit.source: How to use the SendGrid email service (Node.js) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use the SendGrid email service (Node.js) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how send email with the SendGrid email service on Azure. Code samples written using the Node.js API.
trans-unit.target: Learn how send email with the SendGrid email service on Azure. Code samples written using the Node.js API.

trans-unit.source: This guide demonstrates how to perform common programming tasks with the SendGrid email service on Azure.
trans-unit.target: This guide demonstrates how to perform common programming tasks with the SendGrid email service on Azure.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written using the Node.js API.
trans-unit.target: The samples are written using the Node.js API.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include constructing email, sending email, adding attachments, using filters, and updating properties.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include constructing email, sending email, adding attachments, using filters, and updating properties.

trans-unit.source: For more information on SendGrid and sending email, see the <linkText>Next Steps</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: For more information on SendGrid and sending email, see the <linkText>Next Steps</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid is a [cloud-based email service] that provides reliable [transactional email delivery], scalability, and real-time analytics along with flexible APIs that make custom integration easy.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid is a [cloud-based email service] that provides reliable [transactional email delivery], scalability, and real-time analytics along with flexible APIs that make custom integration easy.

trans-unit.source: Common SendGrid usage scenarios include:
trans-unit.target: Common SendGrid usage scenarios include:

trans-unit.source: Automatically sending receipts to customers
trans-unit.target: Automatically sending receipts to customers

trans-unit.source: Administering distribution lists for sending customers monthly e-fliers and special offers
trans-unit.target: Administering distribution lists for sending customers monthly e-fliers and special offers

trans-unit.source: Collecting real-time metrics for things like blocked e-mail, and customer responsiveness
trans-unit.target: Collecting real-time metrics for things like blocked e-mail, and customer responsiveness

trans-unit.source: Generating reports to help identify trends
trans-unit.target: Generating reports to help identify trends

trans-unit.source: Forwarding customer inquiries
trans-unit.target: Forwarding customer inquiries

trans-unit.source: Email notifications from your application
trans-unit.target: Email notifications from your application

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>https://sendgrid.com</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>https://sendgrid.com</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The SendGrid module for Node.js can be installed through the node package manager (npm) by using the following command:
trans-unit.target: The SendGrid module for Node.js can be installed through the node package manager (npm) by using the following command:

trans-unit.source: After installation, you can require the module in your application by using the following code:
trans-unit.target: After installation, you can require the module in your application by using the following code:

trans-unit.source: The SendGrid module exports the SendGrid and Email functions.
trans-unit.target: The SendGrid module exports the SendGrid and Email functions.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid is responsible for sending email through Web API, while Email encapsulates an email message.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid is responsible for sending email through Web API, while Email encapsulates an email message.

trans-unit.source: Creating an email message using the SendGrid module involves first creating an email message using the Email function, and then sending it using the SendGrid function.
trans-unit.target: Creating an email message using the SendGrid module involves first creating an email message using the Email function, and then sending it using the SendGrid function.

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of creating a new message using the Email function:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of creating a new message using the Email function:

trans-unit.source: You can also specify an HTML message for clients that support it by setting the html property.
trans-unit.target: You can also specify an HTML message for clients that support it by setting the html property.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Setting both the text and html properties provides graceful fallback to text content for clients that cannot support HTML messages.
trans-unit.target: Setting both the text and html properties provides graceful fallback to text content for clients that cannot support HTML messages.

trans-unit.source: For more information on all properties supported by the Email function, see <linkText>sendgrid-nodejs</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on all properties supported by the Email function, see <linkText>sendgrid-nodejs</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After creating an email message using the Email function, you can send it using the Web API provided by SendGrid.
trans-unit.target: After creating an email message using the Email function, you can send it using the Web API provided by SendGrid.

trans-unit.source: While the above examples show passing in an email object and callback function, you can also directly invoke the send function by directly specifying email properties.
trans-unit.target: While the above examples show passing in an email object and callback function, you can also directly invoke the send function by directly specifying email properties.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Attachments can be added to a message by specifying the file name(s) and path(s) in the files property.
trans-unit.target: Attachments can be added to a message by specifying the file name(s) and path(s) in the files property.

trans-unit.source: The following example demonstrates sending an attachment:
trans-unit.target: The following example demonstrates sending an attachment:

trans-unit.source: When using the files property, the file must be accessible through fs.readFile.
trans-unit.target: When using the files property, the file must be accessible through fs.readFile.

trans-unit.source: If the file you wish to attach is hosted in Azure Storage, such as in a Blob container, you must first copy the file to local storage or to an Azure drive before it can be sent as an attachment using the files property.
trans-unit.target: If the file you wish to attach is hosted in Azure Storage, such as in a Blob container, you must first copy the file to local storage or to an Azure drive before it can be sent as an attachment using the files property.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid provides additional email functionality through the use of filters.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid provides additional email functionality through the use of filters.

trans-unit.source: These are settings that can be added to an email message to enable specific functionality such as enabling click tracking, Google analytics, subscription tracking, and so on.
trans-unit.target: These are settings that can be added to an email message to enable specific functionality such as enabling click tracking, Google analytics, subscription tracking, and so on.

trans-unit.source: For a full list of filters, see <linkText>Filter Settings</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For a full list of filters, see <linkText>Filter Settings</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Filters can be applied to a message by using the filters property.
trans-unit.target: Filters can be applied to a message by using the filters property.

trans-unit.source: Each filter is specified by a hash containing filter-specific settings.
trans-unit.target: Each filter is specified by a hash containing filter-specific settings.

trans-unit.source: The following examples demonstrate the footer and click tracking filters:
trans-unit.target: The following examples demonstrate the footer and click tracking filters:

trans-unit.source: Some email properties can be overwritten using set*Property* or appended using add*Property*.
trans-unit.target: Some email properties can be overwritten using set*Property* or appended using add*Property*.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can add additional recipients by using
trans-unit.target: For example, you can add additional recipients by using

trans-unit.source: or set a filter by using
trans-unit.target: or set a filter by using

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>sendgrid-nodejs</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>sendgrid-nodejs</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: SendGrid offers web-based APIs that you can use to leverage additional SendGrid functionality from your Azure application.
trans-unit.target: SendGrid offers web-based APIs that you can use to leverage additional SendGrid functionality from your Azure application.

trans-unit.source: For full details, see the <linkText>SendGrid API documentation</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For full details, see the <linkText>SendGrid API documentation</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Now that you've learned the basics of the SendGrid Email service, follow these links to learn more.
trans-unit.target: Now that you've learned the basics of the SendGrid Email service, follow these links to learn more.
